notesStmt.note: Petri Arrivabeni: inscribed with his name: ‘Io petri Arriuabeni’, undated (folio 1r). David Yitsḥaḳ Karmi: inscribed with his name in an owner’s inscription, undated (folio 2r). Yitsḥaḳ Kohen ben [ .. .. ] Yoshu῾a Kohen: inscribed with his name in an owner’s inscription (folio 2r). Illegible Latin inscription (folio 195v). Giovanni Domenico Carretto, Italian censor (active 1600-1624): inscribed with his name, 1612 (folio 196r ); see 100-1011. Italian inscription: ‘Pentateuco Ebraico ossia li cinque libri di Moise’ (folio 196v).
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: Pentateuch accompanied by masorah magna and masorah parva.

collation.p: 25 quires: i6, ii-xxiv8, xxv5, numbered at the beginning of each quire.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Sefardi square script of late 14th or early 15th century, with punctuation.

decoDesc.decoNote: Masorah in the margin written in micrographic form. 18 full-page panels of micrographical design.

binding.p: Post-1600. Crimson velvet binding. Boxed. Spine: 'Pentateuchus Hebraice. M.S. in Membrana. Mus. Brit. Jure Emptionis. 15,306. Plut.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Prince Augustus Frederick (b. 1773, d. 1843), duke of Sussex: his armorial book-plate, inscribed (inner front cover); his sale 13 August 1844, lot 314: inscribed on folio 1r; purchased by the British Museum through Thomas Thorpe for £20.
